text: Vladimir Maksimovich Salkov (, ; 1 April 1937 – 9 July 2020) was a Russian- Ukrainian football manager and defender. He was born in Stalino, Ukrainian SSR. He was known for playing and coaching with Shakhtar Donetsk. He also held brief assistant managing sessions with the Soviet Union national football team. Salkov died on 9 July 2020, aged 83.Умер Владимир Сальков == Honours == === As player=== *Soviet Cup (with Shakhtar Donetsk) ** Champion (2): 1961, 1962 === As coach=== * 1988 Summer Olympics (with Soviet team) ** Olympic gold (1): 1988 (as an assistant) *Ukrainian Cup (with Shakhtar Donetsk) ** Champion (1): 1995 *Soviet Top League (all with Shakhtar Donetsk) ** Runner-up, silver (1): 1975 ** Runner-up, bronze (1): 1978 *Soviet Cup (with Shakhtar Donetsk) ** Finalist (1): 1978 *Russian Premier League (with Rotor Volgograd) ** Runner-up, silver (1): 1993 == References == Category:1937 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Russian footballers Category:Ukrainian footballers Category:Russian football managers Category:Ukrainian football managers
title: Vladimir Salkov
